title: Digital Technology and Learner Identity: A Blended Approach for Mathematics Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and experience using personal devices (BYOD)
context.additional_context: Mathematics competency enhancement program for in-service employees, simultaneously aiming for self-directed learning and identity formation using digital tools

learning_goals: Using digital tools (iPad, etc.), learners can specifically describe at least three aspects of their learning identity during the math problem-solving process
Based on digitally created/shared content (notes, solution videos, etc.) in blended learning environments, learners can analyze at least two role identities in peer interactions
Learners can revise digital technology usage strategies based on formative assessment feedback and describe their impact on learning attitudes within approximately 150 characters

resources: Personal Device-Compatible Math Apps (GeoGebra, Desmos, etc.)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
